alert.note: Alert for Mercer (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:38AM EST until January 10 at 1:45PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Assunpink Creek At Trenton affecting Mercer County. For the Assunpink Creek...including Trenton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Assunpink Creek at Trenton. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Assunpink Park floods. George Page Park floods. Minor street flooding in Trenton. At 9.0 feet, Mulberry Street begins to flood. At 10.0 feet, Mulberry Street flooding increases. Evacuations possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM EST Wednesday was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.1 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 03/30/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Assunpink Creek Trenton 8.5 8.5 Wed 3 am 7.1 5.7 9.1 7am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 145 PM EST.
